definition: to pluck a pearl from the black dragon (idiom, from Zhuangzi); fig. to pick out the salient points (from a tangled situation)/to see through to the nub
to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward
black horse/jet steed/good horse/legendary black dragon
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
bead/pearl/CL:粒[li4],顆|颗[ke1]
see 獨具隻眼|独具只眼[du2 ju4 zhi1 yan3]
a thousand tries leads to one success (idiom, humble expr.); Even without any notable ability on my part, I may still get it right sometimes by good luck.
to probe deeply and uncover minute details
see 追本溯源[zhui1 ben3 su4 yuan2]

lit. Ying writes a letter and Yan reads it/fig. to misinterpret the original meaning/to pile up errors/refers to the letter from capital 郢[Ying3] of 楚[Chu3] in which the inadvertent words "hold up the candle" are mistaken by the minister of 燕[Yan1] as "promote the wise"
to explain in simple terms/succinct/concise
simple words with a profound meaning (idiom)
to savor fine writing (idiom)
lit. catch fish then forget the trap (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); fig. to take help for granted
masterly/subtle and clever (or artwork, writing etc)
to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently
subtle words with profound meaning (idiom)
to dig into piles of outdated writings (idiom); to study old books and papers
variant of 原原本本[yuan2 yuan2 ben3 ben3]
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
facing a wall, an imaginary construction (idiom); baseless fabrication
